Riot said that if they were to change aatrox he'd be in the diver update
Let's rework some marksmans, juggernauts, and assassins first!

Aatrox should get the old Sion's AOE lifesteal on his ult.

Currently he is terrible in teamfights
His theme is about inspiring other warriors to fight. What better way than to let them taste the blood of their enemies and regenerate from it?

Riot: Nope, nope, nope, let's give this AOE heal to Fiora, because she's a duelist and needs a better presence in teamfights.

No offense, but AOE life steal is the most retarded thing on Earth. What if, let's say, no one AAs in your team besides you? I hope they find a better idea for an ultimate than a stupid AOE life steal buff.
Have you seem old Sion? It wasn't a buff to life steal of your team, it would heal them as Sion life stealed if they were close enough.

I know what it does. But it is not what his ult should get reworked into. It is unoriginal and does not fit his playstyle. He is a splitpusher and engages into a fight with the goal of killing the enemy carry. He is not Soraka. His current ult needs a rework, but not heal-related. It already exists in his kit through his W.

It's actually the opposite problem, his play style does not fit his theme at all. An ultimate like this would push him better in the direction of his theme, maybe not by much, but definitely better, although I argue his ultimate should be more about inspiring frenzy and blood lust in his teammates rather then just life steal. 

If he's a split pusher and basically a suicide bombing fighter, then why is his theme about commanding and rallying soldiers into battle? His theme should be about the supportive fighter mix. Right now its pretty much the exact opposite.

I posted this below.

Honestly, lore things are not related to gameplay at all. Look at Aurelion Sol. He is supposed to have created the world but his kit is so not his lore. Yasuo has to do with wind but he literally shoots a tornado every now and then, nothing else.

Also, adding something like that into his kit would make him even more unbalanced and probably will lead to getting nerfed and end up being like he is now.

Aurelion Sol is a case of being considered an overall disappointment as a champion specifically because of literally exactly what you said: he doesn't deliver on his fantasy. His abysmal player base is largely drawn to him only because they like his positional style of play. Were he ever to get a spike in play-rate, you could almost guarantee that it would be due to his numbers being over-tuned. 

But even still, his theme is a galactic dragon, if you were to go in game with no knowledge of that, you'd be able to figure that out just by playing him.

Aatrox's theme is about being a commander who inspires blood lust and frenzy in his allies. No where in his kit do you see this sort of thing being expressed. Outside of the fact that he's something of a blood soldier, which credit where it's due, they do deliver on that end.  

Yasuo has to do with specifically agility, wind being the theme behind him, hence why two of his abilities are wind based, wind wall and tornadoes, and his other two skills being rapid dashes of mobility, it ties extremely well to his lore, apart from the fact he's overloaded as fuck.  

And if we're going to talk about recent champion releases, look at Jhin, he has been by far one of the most popular champions in the months after his release and when you look at why, it's because so many people love how his character delivers on his fantasy of setting up for the perfect kill, right down to his abilities, his VO, and his animations. 

Lore may not directly influence gameplay, but it gives champions a sense of direction for how to set their game play up and their identity on the battlefield. The lore is often times the driving force for the success behind a champion. 

And as for being unbalanceable, not really, we've seen all kinds of abilities utilized in this game, a team wide buff within an AoE isn't exactly a game breaking concept never done before. 

As mentioned, Fiora has an AoE heal should the target die or all 4 vitals go off. Sion had life steal for his entire team. Janna has a MS buff in addition to a disengage AoE heal, Galio has a MS buff as well in the form of a trail, Kindred's AoE grants invunerability. Illaoi's offers a stupid high level of a team zone control. And this just off the top of my head. 

Our next champion to be released, Kled, has an AoE teamwide MS buff as well. 

And I find it ironic how you talk about such an ult would be difficult to balance, yet the way Aatrox's kit current is, he simply can not be balanced as his kit is a stat check: either he has better stats then you and he's going to roll over you through his drain tanking, or he doesn't and he's going to get wrecked.
Numerous people have suggested he get old Sion's ult which would fit him pretty well

As an Aatrox player, no he shouldn't. Sion's old ultimate was left in the dust for a solid reason - thinking Aatrox needs one of the most outdated abilities in the game is just lazy thinking, no offense intended. 

He isn't "terrible" in team fights - he's arguably more functional than Kha'Zix (I've mained both) when the enemy is always grouped. His problems come from how easy it is to AA cancel unintentionally, the clunkiness of his Q, and how most people don't know how to play around him (or build alongside him). If he has another engager to go in with or before him, he's a ridiculously strong team fighter. I love it when I have an Alistar or Nautilus on my team for this reason alone.
Aatrox is a diver, kha'zix is an assassin, What do you think? Kha'zix will be better at teamfighting?

He can't be buffed traditionally as he is a binary champion - like old Fiora was.
This means that even with the slightest damage buffs, he gets out of hand considering he has built in lifesteal and R + revive and any advantage like this early can get out of hand pretty quickly.

That means Riot can't throw some buffs or nerfs his way and see what sticks.

Aatrox is a drain tank, and Riot can't handle them. Look at their past history with drain tanks: 

* They all but deleted Warwick.
* They nerfed Olaf so hard that for a couple years if a champion got crushed in the patch notes it was said that they "got Olaf'd".
* Aatrox has never been a big deal even back when he debuted.
* Graves is an _accidental_ ranged drain tank and that's so wrong it can't be put into words to do it justice.
* Xin is so delicate with his balance that any small change could instantly take him into OP or UP territory.
* The healthiest "drain tank" we have currently is probably Irelia, but she focuses on other things and only dabbles in being a drain tank.

Riot is probably going to try a solution with the upcoming WW rework. If it succeeds in being healthy and makes drain tanking easier to balance, they'll probably spread it to Aatrox and the other drain tanks in some form.

Sounds like a good plan, except CertainlyT is the one doing the rework and that guy couldn't make something healthy if he was a chef at Whole Foods. CerT is known for a lot of things, but "easy to balance" and "healthy to play against" are not among them. In fact, it's the opposite.

If I were an Aatrox fan, I would be paying very close attention to the upcoming Warwick rework. For better or worse.

If they improved the quality of his Q, by making the epicenter larger and even making it so that he cannot be displaced at some point during Dark Flight (Q), then it would make a lot of situations so much more bearable. I think he has more extensive problems than that, but playing him as much as I do, I can say his Q is without a doubt the most dysfunctional part of his kit.

If they don't want to do that, then they could improve his base stats. Once upon a time, it made sense, but he's probably the squishiest fighter in the game with some of the clunkiest mechanics at that. His autos are ridiculously easy to cancel, he can be kited super easily, even with his ultimate range extension, and his Q's most important aspect misses so damn easily. It feels like a suicidal skill shot more than a reliable engage.

I agree with those QOL changes. It doesn't push him into becoming an obnoxious piece of cr@p but relieves some of his issues and allows him smoother transitions in the game. That's something I hoped Riot would be thinking about for a long time now but alas, in their eyes it's just not worth the time to help Aatrox or his playerbase.
Sadly, it feels bad being in the 0.64% of the playerbase. That's how often Aatrox is played above Gold, anyways.
